{{About|the menu screen in {{MC}}|the {{MCD}} menu|Dungeons:Menu screen}}{{Stub|Add description on how menu screens generally work, including the different UIs and usage of UI elements}}{{Relevant tutorial|Menu screen/Bedrock Edition|Menu screen/Java Edition}}
''[[Minecraft]]'' features a multitude of '''menu screens''', which allow the player to navigate to worlds and servers, and change how the game looks.

== Usage ==

== List of menu screens ==
* [[Title Screen]] &ndash; the menu shown upon game startup allowing for access to worlds.
* [[Server list]] &ndash; a menu which allows players to join and save the [[server]]s they visit.
* [[Pause menu]] &ndash; a menu accessible during gameplay which allows players to quit to title or disconnect from a server, access options, enable [[LAN]] &ndash; and etc.
* [[Select World]] &ndash; allowing one of multiple worlds to be accessed.
** [[Create New World]] &ndash; a menu allowing for the configuration of multiple aspects for a new world.
*** [[Seed Templates]] &ndash; a menu to choose a preset seed with specific features or terrain in ''[[Bedrock Edition]]''.
** [[World Options]] &ndash; a menu to manage the world settings and management.
* [[Options]] &ndash; which are configurable via a series of menus in {{JE}}.
* [[Settings]] &ndash; which are configurable via a series of menus in {{BE}}.
* [[Controls]] &ndash; a subset of options, also given a dedicated menu.
** [[Super Secret Settings]] &ndash; which applies in-game [[shader]]s, removed after [[Java Edition 1.9]].
* [[How to Play]] &ndash; a menu which shows built-in guides designed to help new players to ''Minecraft''.
* [[Loading world screen]] &ndash; the menu shown while entering or leaving a world.
* [[Realms Stories]] &ndash; a social hub for members of a [[Realms|Realm]] in ''[[Bedrock Edition]]''.
* [[Chat]]<ref group="note">This is a menu screen only {{In|be}}. {{IN|je}}, the chat is part of the [[UI]].</ref> &ndash; a messaging system to communicate with players and execute [[commands]].
